execSnapshot: 53 acres under contract with Amazon; PSA progressing toward non-refundable in March 2026.
Block 2 Retail shovel-ready; tenant negotiations and equity raise advancing.
Del Via lease-up ongoing; occupancy at 14.3% with elevated concessions.

summary: Amazon and substation land monetization remain the primary near-term value drivers.
Retail and multifamily verticals continue to progress in parallel.
Permitting and site readiness milestones keep the Retail Core and Block 2 positioned for quick mobilization.
details: Amazon: PSA executed 9/28/2025 with $500k earnest money; diligence and end-user site plan in progress; prelim plan submitted and under review.
Amazon: Additional 25-acre LOI for a distribution facility (countered at $14.5/land sf).
Austin Energy Substation: Awaiting final transmission route to start survey/appraisal; estimated closing Q4 2026.
Block 2 Retail: Shovel-ready; negotiating with Shiner Smokehouse to replace Portillo's; 22,000 SF inline prospects engaged; lender ready and equity raise progressing.
Retail Core & Master Plan: Design and permitting on track; permits expected April 2026.
Del Via: Occupancy 14.33%; Leased 19.21%; Market Rent $2.19/sf | $1,796/unit; Concessions 6–10 weeks free (12.5%–20.8%).

landSales.title: Amazon Land Sale
commentary: PSA executed with $500k earnest money; diligence and end-user site plan underway.
City review pacing toward the March non-refundable date and June closing target.

visuals.title: Amazon tract and LOI context
visuals.caption: Acreage under contract and adjacent LOI parcel within the broader site plan.

retail.title: Block 2 Retail

statusSnapshot.title: Status Snapshot
items: Anchor: Negotiating with Shiner Smokehouse (replacing Portillo's)
Capital: Construction lender ready; equity raise progressing with two groups

commentary: Negotiations advancing with Shiner Smokehouse for anchor replacement; inline prospects engaged for 22,000 SF.
Lender is ready to close; equity raise moving forward with two strong investor groups.
Site is fully prepped, allowing rapid mobilization once anchors and capital stack finalize.

visuals.title: Block 2 retail plan
visuals.caption: Block 2 retail layout, pad readiness, and anchor/inline tenant positioning.

multifamily.title: Del Via Multifamily

statusSnapshot.title: Metrics Snapshot
items: Status: Lease-up underway; retail activation supports absorption

commentary: Lease-up continues with concessions supporting early absorption while retail activation advances.
Stabilization depends on synchronized retail delivery and sustained employer-driven demand.

visuals.title: Del Via lease-up
visuals.caption: Current lease-up positioning and unit delivery phasing for Del Via.

risks: Amazon PSA not yet non-refundable; dates dependent on diligence and city review.
TIRZ reimbursement timing dependent on collections.
Retail anchor/in-line leasing still in negotiation; capital stack timing linked to leasing.
appendix: Regional & Macro Context provided for reference and not directly tied to underwriting.
Tesla: 20,000+ employees on ~10M SF built, 5M SF underway; robotaxi launch scaling; Optimus factory and AI chip partnership anchoring Austin.
NVIDIA: Doubling Austin presence with ~100k SF lease; >1M SF U.S. manufacturing capacity for AI supercomputers/Blackwell chips.
Samsung: $40B+ Taylor campus nearing late-2026 operations; $250M state grant; first phase moving ~1,000 employees by late 2025.
ABIA: $4–6B Journey With AUS expansion toward new 20+ gate Concourse B (early 2030s target).
Apple: $600B U.S. investment plan with Austin expansion; second campus under construction; Riata rezoning signals mixed-use potential.
Compal/Pegatron: Localization of device assembly and electronics manufacturing adding ~1,000+ jobs regionally.
